name: Brown Leather Eyepatch
description: A simple, functional eyepatch made of worn brown leather. Cade wears this item at all times to cover his disfigured left eye. The eye, a result of the experiments performed on him, glows with a faint blue light and is visually disturbing. The eyepatch serves no magical function but is crucial for Cade to avoid unwanted attention and questions about his past.
key_facts: A mundane item worn by Cade.
Made of brown leather.
Conceals his glowing blue, disfigured left eye.
gm_notes: The forcible removal of the eyepatch would be a significant and dramatic moment for Cade, revealing his secret and potentially causing fear or suspicion in onlookers. It is a symbol of his shame and the trauma he has endured.

name: N’guraleth (The Black Maw Shard)
description: The N'guraleth, or Black Maw Shard, is a sliver of pure malevolence carved from the very flesh of the dark god Vusog. It appears as a shard of polished obsidian that constantly weeps a cold, spectral ichor. When this artifact is implanted into a mortal, it irrevocably taints them, slowly and painfully transforming them into a Vessel for Vusog. This is the shard that was forced into Cade, causing his magic to manifest as black smoke.
key_facts: A fragment of the god Vusog's own essence.
Appears as an obsidian shard slick with spectral ichor.
Begins the transformation of a mortal into Vusog's Vessel.
This shard was implanted into Cade.
gm_notes: The shard is the source of Cade's smoke magic and his connection to Vusog. It cannot be easily removed and may resist attempts to do so. Vusog's followers can likely sense the shard, making Cade a constant target.

name: Niktogauss
description: Niktogauss is a dangerous and highly addictive substance created from magically extracted soul energy. It appears as a swirling black smoke contained within glass vials or phials. When inhaled, it provides a temporary but significant bolster to a user's physical strength and stamina. However, repeated use leads to severe addiction and potential side effects, including the state of Hypohallucinogenics for magic-users.
key_facts: A drug made from extracted soul energy.
Appears as black smoke in a vial.
Inhaled to temporarily boost strength.
Highly addictive with dangerous side effects.
gm_notes: Mechanically, using Niktogauss could grant advantage on Strength checks and saving throws for a short period, followed by a level of exhaustion. Repeated use would require Constitution saving throws to avoid addiction.

name: Havik’s Patchwork Cloak
description: Havik's cloak is a mundane but deeply personal item, crafted from numerous fabric squares given to him by the street urchins he has protected. Each patch is a memento from a person he has saved or a life he has touched. Though it offers no magical protection, the cloak is a powerful symbol of his vows, his memories, and the ghosts of his past. It is a physical representation of his role as 'The Stitch.'
key_facts: Made from fabric squares given by urchins Havik has saved.
A symbolic item, not a magical one.
Represents his vows, memories, and his role as a protector ('The Stitch').
gm_notes: Destroying or damaging the cloak would be a deep emotional blow to Havik. He may add new patches to it over time as he helps more people, allowing the item to evolve with his story.

name: Wren’s Doll’s Glass Eye
description: This is a single glass button, taken from a doll belonging to Wren, Havik's friend who perished in a fire. Though blackened by soot, the eye remains intact. Havik has sewn it into his patchwork cloak directly above his heart. It serves as his personal arcane focus, but more importantly, it is his emotional anchor, a constant reminder of his loss and the reason he fights to protect others.
key_facts: A glass eye from a doll belonging to Havik's deceased friend, Wren.
Blackened by fire but intact.
Sewn into Havik's cloak above his heart.
Functions as his arcane focus and a powerful emotional memento.
gm_notes: As an arcane focus, all of Havik's magic is channeled through this object, tying his power directly to his most painful memory. If he were to lose it, he might be unable to control his magic or even cast spells at all until it is recovered.

name: Lost Holy Weapon of Lathander
description: Legends among the followers of the Morninglord speak of a holy weapon, perhaps a mace or a longsword known as 'Dawnbringer' or a similar name, lost long ago in a battle against a great evil. Kalen believes that finding and restoring this weapon is a crucial step in his quest. The weapon is said to be a beacon of hope, capable of vanquishing darkness and restoring light to blighted lands.
key_facts: A legendary holy weapon associated with the god Lathander.
It was lost long ago in a battle with a powerful evil.
Kalen seeks to find and restore this weapon.
Believed to have great power against darkness and undead.
gm_notes: This serves as a major quest objective for Kalen. The weapon may be shattered, its pieces scattered, or it could be in the possession of a powerful foe. Restoring it would likely require great deeds and grant Kalen a significant power boost.

name: Lost Relics of Lathander
description: Beyond a single weapon, many holy artifacts of Lathander's faith have been lost over the centuries. These include sacred scriptures detailing forgotten rites, relics such as the bones of saints or pieces of a blessed altar, and ceremonial vestments. Kalen's quest includes the recovery of these items to restore them to the faithful, strengthening the Order and rekindling the light of Lathander in a darkening world.
key_facts: Various holy items of Lathander's faith that have been lost.
Includes scriptures, saintly relics, and ceremonial items.
Kalen is on a quest to find and restore them to his Order.
gm_notes: This is a broader quest that can be broken into smaller adventures, each focused on recovering a single lost relic. Each returned artifact could grant the Order (and by extension, Kalen) a new boon or piece of vital information.

name: Dwarven Thrower
description: A Dwarven Thrower is a legendary warhammer, a pinnacle of dwarven runic craftsmanship. When wielded by a dwarf, its true power is unlocked. It feels lighter, strikes with thunderous force, and magically returns to the wielder's hand when thrown. It is considered a priceless relic and a symbol of dwarven martial pride.
key_facts: A powerful magic warhammer of dwarven make.
Gains special properties when wielded by a dwarf.
Returns to the wielder's hand when thrown.
A legendary and highly sought-after weapon.
gm_notes: This is a specific, well-known magic item in the D&D universe. It would be a perfect ultimate weapon for a dwarven character like Moriah, perhaps as a reward for a major quest or something she could aspire to craft herself, fulfilling the prophecy.

name: Horns of Moradin
description: The Horns of Moradin are a set of ornate, ceremonial horns that the Crommer dwarf clan has hired Moriah to create. The commission specifies that they be crafted from silver, brass, and gold. Their purpose is to honor both the dwarven Forge-Father, Moradin, and the human deity of new beginnings, Lathander, reflecting the Crommer clan's unique dual faith. The horns are intended to be masterpieces of smithing and artistry.
key_facts: Ornate, ceremonial horns made of silver, brass, and gold.
Moriah has been hired by the Crommer family to create them.
Intended to honor both Moradin and Lathander.
gm_notes: This commission is a major plot hook for Moriah. Acquiring the rare materials, designing the horns, and protecting them from rivals or thieves could form a significant adventure arc. Completing the horns would bring her great prestige.

name: Mithril
description: Mithril is a legendary silvery metal, prized by smiths for being as strong as steel yet feather-light. It is exceptionally rare, found only in a few remote locations and zealously guarded by those who mine it. Armor made from mithril is lighter than standard metal armor and doesn't impose disadvantages on stealth, making it highly valuable to warriors and rogues alike.
key_facts: A rare, silvery metal, as strong as steel but much lighter.
Highly valued by smiths and warriors.
Armor made from it does not impose a stealth disadvantage.
An exceptionally valuable and rare crafting material.
gm_notes: Mithril would be a necessary component for many high-level crafting quests, including potentially the Horns of Moradin or a custom suit of armor for an adventurer. A quest could revolve around finding a lost vein of mithril or stealing it from a dragon's hoard.

name: Magic Fountain
description: Located within the Sun Soul monastery, this fountain provides a continuous source of magically purified water. The water is cool, refreshing, and free of any impurity. This fountain is not just for the monks; its waters are shared freely with the local community, serving as a symbol of the monastery's generosity and its role as a provider for the people.
key_facts: A fountain with a source of magically purified water.
Located in the Sun Soul monastery.
The water is shared with the local community.
A symbol of the monastery's generosity.
gm_notes: The water might have minor healing properties (e.g., curing minor diseases or providing temporary hit points). The fountain could become the target of an enemy seeking to poison the community or corrupt the monastery's influence.

name: Magic Hot Spring Water
description: The baths at the Sun Soul monastery are heated by magically infused hot spring water. This water was a gift from a visiting high priestess, who blessed the monastery's spring. The water soothes weary muscles and calms the mind, making the baths a central part of the monks' daily ritual of meditation and physical recovery.
key_facts: Heats the baths at the Sun Soul monastery.
A gift from a visiting high priestess.
The water has soothing and calming properties.
Aids in meditation and physical recovery.
gm_notes: Spending an hour in these baths could grant a character a temporary bonus to saves against exhaustion or similar effects. The original blessing might fade, requiring the players to seek out the high priestess or a similar power to restore it.

name: Monastery's Magical Armory
description: The Sun Soul monastery maintains an armory containing weapons for training and for the defense of the sanctuary. While most of the weapons are mundane but of masterwork quality, the armory also contains a collection of magical monastic weapons. These may include staves that glow with inner light, handwraps that strike with elemental fury, or sickles that return when thrown. Access is restricted to trusted members of the order.
key_facts: An armory within the Sun Soul monastery.
Contains both mundane and magical monastic weapons.
Access is restricted to trusted monks.
A vital resource for defending the monastery.
gm_notes: The armory is a potential source of weapon upgrades for a monk character. A quest could involve retrieving a stolen weapon from the armory or being granted access to a specific item after proving one's worth and dedication to the monastery's principles.

name: Resplendence of Three Lights
description: The 'Resplendence of Three Lights' refers collectively to the masterfully crafted golden chapel doors and the various artistic icons within the Sun Soul monastery's main sanctuary. These works of art depict the three solar aspects: Lathander (Dawn), Aumanator (Noon), and Selûne (Night/Moon). They are not merely decorative, but serve as focal points for meditation, representing the core philosophy of the order in brilliant, artistic form.
key_facts: The name for the golden chapel doors and icons within the Sun Soul sanctuary.
The art depicts the Three Suns: Lathander, Aumanator, and Selûne.
Serves as a focus for meditation on the order's core philosophy.
gm_notes: These artistic pieces could hold secrets. A particular icon might reveal a hidden passage when touched in a certain sequence, or the chapel doors might align with the sun on a specific day to reveal a clue or prophecy.
